data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current settings for subscription tracking.**

Subscription tracking adds links to the bottom of your emails that allows your recipients to subscribe to, or unsubscribe from, your emails.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current subscription tracking settings for your account. Subscription tracking enables unsubscribe and subscription management links in your emails, allowing recipients to manage their subscription preferences. Returns the SubscriptionTrackingSettings object containing the current configuration state and enabled status.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic and doesn't clarify that this retrieves the current/active configuration. Description lacks clarity about what is returned (response schema). Added specificity about the returned object type and clarified the purpose of subscription tracking links for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current settings for subscription tracking.**

Subscription tracking adds links to the bottom of your emails that allows your recipients to subscribe to, or unsubscribe from, your emails.
data.description_suggestion: Updates your account's subscription tracking configuration. Accepts a SubscriptionTrackingSettings object to enable or disable subscription tracking functionality. When enabled, subscription and unsubscribe management links are automatically added to the bottom of your emails. Returns the updated SubscriptionTrackingSettings object reflecting the new configuration. Changes apply to all future emails sent from your account.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't indicate the specific action (enable/disable). Description lacks input details (what SubscriptionTrackingSettings contains), output details (what is returned), and side effects (changes apply to future emails). Enhanced version clarifies the input schema, return value, and the scope of the configuration change for improved AI agent decision-making about when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to enable or disable your current click tracking setting.**

Click Tracking overrides all the links and URLs in your emails and points them to either SendGrid's servers or the domain with which you branded your link. When a customer clicks a link, SendGrid tracks those [clicks](https://sendgrid.com/docs/glossary/clicks/).

Click tracking helps you understand how users are engaging with your communications. SendGrid can track up to 1000 links per email
data.description_suggestion: Enables or disables click tracking for your account. Accepts a request body with an 'enabled' boolean field to control whether SendGrid tracks link clicks in your emails. When enabled, all links and URLs in emails are redirected through SendGrid's servers or your branded domain to track click events. Returns the updated click tracking setting object. This change applies to all future emails sent from your account.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks critical input details (what fields are required in the request body) and output details (what is returned). Missing side effects information about when the change takes effect and its scope. Enhanced description clarifies the request structure, return value, and impact on future emails.

message: Operation 'ListGoogleAnalyticsTrackingSetting' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Summary is clear and appropriate. data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current setting for Google Analytics.**


Google Analytics helps you understand how users got to your site and what they're doing there. For more information about using Google Analytics, please refer to [Google's URL Builder](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1033867?hl=en) and their article on ["Best Practices for Campaign Building"](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1037445).

We default the settings to Google's recommendations. For more information, see [Google Analytics Demystified](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/google-analytics/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves your current Google Analytics tracking configuration. Returns a GoogleAnalyticsSettings object containing your campaign source, medium, term, content, and name parameters used to tag emails for Google Analytics tracking. These settings allow you to track email campaign performance within Google Analytics. If not previously configured, returns default values based on Google's recommendations.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description provides context about Google Analytics but lacks specificity about what fields are returned in the response. Enhanced description clarifies the structure of the returned GoogleAnalyticsSettings object and explains what each setting represents for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current settings for open tracking.**

Open Tracking adds an invisible image at the end of the email which can track email opens.

If the email recipient has images enabled on their email client, a request to SendGrid's server for the invisible image is executed and an open event is logged.

These events are logged in the Statistics portal, Email Activity interface, and are reported by the Event Webhook.
data.description_suggestion: Enables or disables open tracking for your account. Accepts a request body with an 'enabled' boolean field to control whether SendGrid tracks email opens. When enabled, an invisible tracking image is appended to emails; opens are logged when recipients load images. Returns the updated open tracking setting object. Open events are recorded in the Statistics portal, Email Activity interface, and reported via the Event Webhook. This change applies to all future emails sent from your account.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description lacks input details (request body structure), output details (response format), and side effects (when changes take effect and scope). Enhanced description clarifies the request structure, return value, how tracking works, and that changes apply to future emails for better AI agent understanding.
